action.action-desc: Mrs. Walorski (for herself and Mr. Arrington) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the research tax credit and provide better access to the credit for business startups.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fostering Innovation and Research to Strengthen Tomorrow Act.

section.header: Increase in research credit and better access to credit for startups

paragraph.text: Section 41(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 20 percent each place it appears and inserting 40 percent.
Section 41(c)(4)(A) of such Code is amended by striking 14 percent and inserting 28 percent.

paragraph.header: Credit rate in case of no research expenses in 3 preceding years
paragraph.text: Section 41(c)(4)(B)(ii) of such Code is amended by striking 6 percent and inserting 1/2 the credit percentage in effect under subparagraph (A).

subsection.header: Modification of small business portion allowed against payroll tax

paragraph.text: Paragraphs (4)(B)(i) and (5)(B)(ii) of section 41(h) of such Code are each amended by striking $250,000 and inserting $500,000.

paragraph.header: Qualified small business gross receipts threshold
paragraph.text: Section 41(h)(3)(A)(i)(I) of such Code is amended by striking $5,000,000 and inserting the dollar amount in effect for the taxable year under section 448(c)(1).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
